sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![Graph Image](https://i.imgur.com/PD27COy.png)

What is the chromatic index of this graph?
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color. In the given graph, we can see that the maximum degree (Δ) of any vertex is 3.

According to Vizing's theorem, the chromatic index (χ') of a graph G is either equal to the maximum degree (Δ) or Δ + 1. So, the chromatic index of this graph will be either 3 or 4.

By trying to color the edges of the graph, we can find a valid edge coloring using 3 colors:

1. Color the top horizontal edge with color 1.
2. Color the left diagonal edge with color 2.
3. Color the right diagonal edge with color 3.
4. Color the bottom horizontal edge with color 1.
5. Color the left vertical edge with color 3.
6. Color the right vertical edge with color 2.

Since we found a valid edge coloring using 3 colors, the chromatic index of this graph is 3.
